tool_description: A Web API built to fill the gaps in Power Automate, providing useful utility functions currently not available (and painful to workaround) in the platform.
name: Power Automate Helper
title: Power Automate Helper

api_list.name: ReplaceAll
api_list.description: In a string, find and replace all instances of a substring. This endpoint is case-sensitive, and does not accept Regular Expressions. For an endpoint which can be case-insensitive and does accept Regular Expressions, see RegexReplace.

required_parameters.name: replaceValue
required_parameters.description: Provide the value you want to replace the searchValue with.

required_parameters.name: sourceString
required_parameters.description: Provide the source string which you want to find and replace within.

required_parameters.name: searchValue
required_parameters.description: Provide the value to find in the sourceString.

api_list.name: RegEx
api_list.description: Validates that a string matches a supplied RegEx pattern.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://power-automate-helper.p.rapidapi.com/api/validate/regex"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "power-automate-helper.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://power-automate-helper.p.rapidapi.com/api/validate/regex"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "power-automate-helper.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Mode
api_list.description:
Calculates the mode (the number that occurs most often) from an array of numbers. Strings that can be converted to numbers are allowed. 

If multiple instances of the same number are passed in separately as a string and a number, they will be counted as instances of the same number.

If no numbers occur more than once, the last number in the array will be returned.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://power-automate-helper.p.rapidapi.com/api/math/mode"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "power-automate-helper.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Round
api_list.description: Rounds a number to the nearest integer. If an integer is passed in, it will be returned unchanged. Supports numbers passed in as strings, but does NOT support commas or other formatting in number strings.

api_list.name: FindFirst
api_list.description: Accepts an array of any data type. Returns the first item that matches the specified condition. If no item matches the condition, null is returned. Use the 'this' keyword for the propertyName to compare the array item itself.

api_list.name: RemoveFirst
api_list.description:

api_list.name: Prepend
api_list.description: Accepts an array and a value, and returns the array with the value added as the first item in the array. The value can also be an array; in this case a flat array will be returned with each of the items prepended.

api_list.name: SortByProperty
api_list.description: Sorts an array of objects by the property specified. Accepts empty arrays. If any objects lack the specified property, it will still perform the sort. Optionally accepts the parameter 'descending'. If left out, it will default to ascending.

api_list.name: UnescapeHtml
api_list.description: Converts entity characters to HTML equivalents. This endpoint supports cent, yen, euro, pound, lt, gt, copy, reg, quote, amp, apos, and nbsp.

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "power-automate-helper.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Slugify
api_list.description: Transform text into an ASCII slug which can be used in safely in URLs. Replaces whitespaces, accentuated, and special characters with a dash.  A limited set of non-ASCII characters are transformed to the nearest characters in the ascii character set such as ä to a.

api_list.name: RegexReplace
api_list.description: In a string, find and replace text based on a Regular Expression. Be sure to include the leading and trailing forward slashes (/), and any flags you wish to include after the trailing slash. For example, use **/test/gi** to match and replace all instances of the word 'test', ignoring case.
